reviews.text:
This was our first time dinning at the Roof Terrace before attending a show downstairs and I would have to say we really enjoyed our visit.

This is the perfect place for a nice romantic dinner date the ambiance and views are absolutely amazing and the foods not bad either🤣🤣🤣

Although it was a little pricey it was still worth the price of admission.  I was told that their Sunday brunch is amazing and I can’t wait to experience that next.

So once again if your looking to enjoy a nice dinner and a show at The Kennedy Center the Roof Terrace is the spot!!

RTR is a pretty good place for dinner before a show at the Kennedy Center. The restaurant has the classic aesthetic of the Kennedy Center with beautiful views from the terrace outside the restaurant. The staff were friendly enough though our waiter didn't talk with us too much. Food service was quick which is to be expected for those going to performances. The quality of the food is okay. All of our entrees were hot but just okay taste wise. Pretty good selection for vegetarians and the fish choices are nice too! We'll come back and try it again as we go to the KC often.

A solid experience one would expect from a prestigious venue like The Kennedy Center. Tremendous ambiance and service. The views from up there are spectacular and enrich the experience of an evening outing. The food was delicious, but not really stand out exceptional. Overall with everything considered, an incredible place that's perfect for a date night.

I have never been to the Kennedy Center and had no idea that there even was a restaurant. What a very nice dining experience. Santo our waiter was very knowledgeable with the food and drinks. It is a bit pricey but worth it. Even if you are not going to an event I highly recommend checking it out.

My husband and I visited the Kennedy Center last night to tour the new JFK exhibit, dine at the Roof Terrace and watched Wicked.  We had an amazing time.  The new exhibit is a great way to immerse yourself in all the aspects surrounding the creation of the National Cultural Center and the role the Kennedys played to make it a reality, which of course, contributed to the re-designation as the Kennedy Center for the Performing Arts.  The Roof Terrace is a very nice restaurant with the most friendly staff and an amazing view of the DC and Virginia skylines.  The only downside is the food is overpriced, in my opinion, for what you receive. The steak I ordered was really good and the lobster mac and cheese definitely did not skimp on the lobster.  The rest of our meal was good, but not at a level commensurate with the price.  You are definitely paying for the location; so just understand that going in.  I would like to re-state the staff were all very welcoming and made sure we had everything we needed.  There is a full bar, beer, and wine available.  The selection was a little small, but diverse.  One other tip, reservations are pretty much a must.  I made a reservation as soon as I purchased tickets for a show, so it was months in advance and I did not have any issues with availablility.  I have tried to make a reservation a week out before and it was booked solid; so just somethingto considerin advance of your visit.  Thank you again for another great evening enjoying the arts in our nation's capital.

I can say the vibe is very easy going and laid back. There is no rush here meaning no one will make you feel like you need to hurry and eat because someone wants your table. The waiters will not pester you about what’s next and you can go at your own pace. With all that being said it takes time to get a drink or appetizers or entrees. But in my opinion on a lazy Saturday afternoon it fit. No complaints the food was respectfully priced and the taste was delicious. Nothing that was to die for or that stood out for me but no one in our party of 30 had a bad thing to say.
We celebrated my Aunts birthday and they accommodated our large party without issue. This place is popular and crowds quickly so thank goodness we had reservations. A very good time and family friendly. We even enjoyed the music. Overall good place with good eats. (No I didn’t get pics of everyone’s plates lol)

This place seems to have been here forever. Very nice and the food was really good. I had an issue though, because I forgot to ask about spices on the fries. They were so very accommodating – they made me whole new fries without any spices. In fact they were very accommodating about several food allergies. Really nice wait staff. But pay attention, because it is not exactly disability friendly. The restrooms are either upstairs or downstairs.

I visited here with my family while visiting the DC area. If you're looking for seafood and healthy portions, look no further.  The restaurant was small and quaint. It had character and smelled like a fish restaurant.  I had the fish and chips. One person could finish this, but would be very full! Split it with your partner and you'll both be satisfied. The clam chowder was delicious as well.  Other members of my family had the fried shrimp and clams. All were delicious. For more of my reviews on restaurants and other places of interest, follow me on Google reviews.

If you're craving blue crab or seafood, you've come to the right place. I didn't know this place existed until I looked for seafood near my home, so I didn't have to travel to Maryland for crab. We came here for our blue crab but ordered other dishes too while waiting for our main course to arrive after 35 minutes. The crab was perfectly cooked and had a delicious marinade, not salty like another crab restaurant we ate at before. Even though there were only 4 of us, we couldn't even finish a dozen of blue crabs. The service is excellent and very attentive whenever we need anything. They're ready for us in a second even though the place is crowded, but the staff run in and out of service like a breathe.

I highly recommend this blue crab restaurant for anyone craving crab and seafood but doesn't forget to make reservations in advance; otherwise, you will either be a long wait or will turn down with no table left for the evening.

Great wings and service.  My friend want crab cakes and when she called Tony indicated there was no wait. When we got there he was correct. You can make reservations. I got Buffalo Wings and she got crab cakes, mussels, mash potatoes and broccoli.  Everything looked, tasted and smelled delicious. They may be known for the whole crabs they serve, but other food is there as well. There's also a bar and to go area on the other side.

Small portion off food 🍱 compared with The others , missing paper Towel . Missing chilly , missing top drink cups , and toilet you have to ask the code to use it , this is not New York!  is Arlington va ! Go across the street great food at cava plus same price and more health for your self

Just ordered dinner for delivery from here, the salad was horrible the onion wasn't even chopped and they gave me almost no dressing at all so I had to drive over there and ask for more because I didn't want to eat a completely dry salad.  In addition they gave me almost no chips, they barely covered the bottom of a small brown paper bag.  I don't have a high bar for Chipotle, but this is just pathetic it feels like I didn't get a full meal and what they did include they put no effort into.  I'm very disappointed.

The server gave me a small portion of steak, so I had to request Double meat to get a normal portion so I cost almost $18 for a regular bowl with double meat and guacamole (the server did give me a larger than regular portion of it, hence the 3 stars instead of 2) and a medium drink, no chips. Hopefully this store can correct this inconsistency, as Chipotle is my Go-To restaurant when I'm traveling...and I'm always travelling with my career.

Very disappointed with this place lately! The server gives you the bowl half full, you have to ask for more to get what you are paying for! And the carnitas...it is disgusting lately, it is the worst pork "meat" I have ever seen! It is some sort of fatty, slimy white-ish "thing" they sell as pork meat. Stay away until they decide to change their current ways!

Made an order at 10:30 for pick up at 11:30 bc I have a tight lunch. Get there at 11:33 and no ones there. Wait until 11:40 and someone comes up and demands my confirmation number. Didn’t bring my phone and she wouldn’t give until i went back and got it. Finally got it. Skimpiest portions if ever got. Barely half full.
My salad was so dry and not even fully filled up, I paid extra for chickpeas and barely saw any. The greens tasted very stale. Do not recommend! 1 star for the quick curbside delivery.

I have been going to Chopt in Rosslyn 2-3 days a week for over 3 years now. This location has provided exceptional service, quality product and exceptional portion sizes consistently. Since moving to the kiosk business model recently, all three of these have declined significantly. From a less personalized experience, to 1/2 full salad bowls and increased wait times this has been a stark contrast to their historic salad making efforts.

Have been to other Chopt locations many times, but today visited this one for the first time. I was surprised to find that, unlike every other Chopt I have visited, you do not place your order with the person making your salad. You can barely even see the kitchen, actually. The store is set up for you to order on a touchscreen if you did not already order ahead. It does look like they can accommodate ordering with a cashier but only by request.

This means that you can't see how much dressing they are adding -- you just have to pick "light/medium/heavy" from the app or the kiosks. I have unfortunately found Chopt to be too inconsistent with this when I order in the app, so I make it a point to order in person. I will not come back to this location.

This place is the worst location at the DMV. I made several online orders and they always give me a the salad half filled up. I complained several time and the managers of the place has the worst attitude never did anything to fix the problem. I stopped ordering online because it is not worth it to pay $13 for a salad that is not filled up to the top. Last week I decided to go and order in person and this time I got my salad right but the customer service was awful. The manager doesn’t greet customers and gives you the word attitude as if you are making her a favor. The manager is an African American lady that wears glasses, she needs to get fired, chopt needs to hire people that actually care about their customers because their salads are expensive and they will go out of business if they keep having such awful customer service.

Not the same as it used to be- My salad was dry even tho I asked for regular dressing, the new bowls are clearly smaller AND the bread I received was also small and stale which just left me feeling disappointed. The new layout doesn’t allow for any interaction with the staff which in my option was what always made me feel confident that I was getting what I asked for. This did not feel like a $13 salad.

No drive through and limited parking. Safe to order ahead if you're driving and park on the street to avoid having to circle the city. People are nice considering the busy demand at this particular location.

An excellent little neighborhood Starbucks. Only giving 4 stars because there's not much room to sit/wait inside but the outside deck is fantastic on a nice day. Great service here and friendly staff! Also they love to really get into the holiday spirit and staff here have been spotted days after Thanksgiving donning antlers and decking the halls -- always high spirits! You won't regret your stop!

This is one of the best Starbucks in Arlington (and there are many).  They make great espresso and food, have a great location, and a friendly staff.  A high-five to Mo, who helps to get food/drinks to the clients when the store is busy.  He is world-class and makes you feel welcome/appreciated. Thanks Mo and the Team!
The best Starbucks in the vicinity. My drinks are always deliciously made at this location.

It’s freezing cold inside and the hot drinks are coming out cooled down. If I wanted iced coffee I would have asked for it. Tried to talk with the staff though too busy getting orders out to make adjustments. I’ll upgrade my rating here when the experience improves.

Oh Goodness Graceless Peoples Your Missing Out Great Meals. Quite Usually Inside While Dining Inside. Friendly Helpful Understanding Employees n Employers. Anything You Need To Power Up A Device's They Have Plentiful Plug Inn's. It's Hard To Find This Place But There Working On It By Coming Up With Ways To Place Their Company's Name Outside Their Rented Building Space. Just Stop By n Support Them By Ordering Something Delicious!

Great service! I have purchased a big order with over 30 items for our staff appreciation day. They prepared every single item with care. One of the soup was missing but they resolved the problem very quick and send the soup to our office within 30 minutes. Professional and great manager and fabulous customer service! Definitely will recommend for company orders.
I come here for exclusively for iced coffee, which has been super inconsistent the last month or two. Sometimes it's good, but nearly half the time it's so weak and just tastes like dirty water.
At a difficult location. Difficult to maintain stores at these kind of locations
I go to this place for 3 weeks in row, 15 times. Everything is great. Thanks.
We have a new Executive Chef George Fassiadis at cityhouse. He has brought an exciting new flair to the menu. I encourage all to stop by and try the new menu!

Ate "brunch" here because we were staying at the Hyatt Arlington and needed a quick place to eat. What should have been a quick decent meal, turned into a long drawn out process with extremely over priced food and service. Definitely not what you would expect to receive on a Hyatt property.

The staff was slow, short and for the most part confused us all while trying to learn more about a couple menu items.

The menu it's self was very very basic with not a lot of depth.

As for the food itself, I'm not sure if they ran to crappy version of Denny's to get our food or if there was really a kitchen staff back there making it. Took around 20 minute for two basic omelettes, a single scrambled egg and a bagel. Again, the quality of the food was definitely not what you would expect.

Highly recommend passing on this place although it's extremely convenient, unless you like over priced sub par food. Only reason it gets a 2/5 is the convenience.

We had to stop here for breakfast for lack of time and I’m glad we did.  Outside of the waitresses having a bit of attitude and being a little pushy to try and get us to order the buffet it was a good experience. Not everyone needs all you can eat and most often it’s a waste of money. I felt like they had quite a few options and as far as hotel hot buffets go, the food looked appetizing and my kids were happy. Two different kinds of sausage, omelets to order, smoothie shots and berry parfaits were among the options. I ordered the oatmeal with various toppings and enjoyed it. The waitress redeemed herself by providing kids to go cups and facilitating a speedy check out.
The breakfast buffet is good, crew is friendly!

July 19, I went there for breakfast. I wanted pancakes decribed on the breakfast menu. I didn't want the buffet. The hostess sat us down. She didnt ask if we wanted to order from menu or buffet. No options were provided. I then told her I wanted to order from kitchen. She says she will get the waiter. Waiter comes : I tell him I want to order from the kitchen. Instead of making an order for pancakes, he talks me into the buffet which we didnt want. So I order the buffet. The chocolate pancakes were hard and the edges were dry. Dissatisfied and Disappointed. Waste of money. Very bad service. Its like he didn't want to be bothered to take my order. Why is there an option to order pancakes on the menu? The only reason im giving 3 stars was because on the previous day 7/18 Mohammed gave excellent impeccable service. And he was doing it all with no help. So I know the standard is there.

Simply delicious and tastes so awesome. I drove past by so many times but never gave a try at this food truck. I was surprised by the quantity and quality of the food. Must try chicken over rice, I have posted the picture of the plater as well.
Place is damn good. Recommend the combo (lamb + chicken) over rice. The vegetarian options are excellent. Love the owner. Don't think about it get it.
I don't leave reviews often, but this guy is just awesome!  skip the overpriced food in Rosslyn and come here!

Loved this place! The guy was so incredibly nice and really quick. This is the combo rice with potatoes. I was hesitant to try the lamb cus I'm picky about how its cooked but this was delicious and not at all funky tasting!! Definitely give it a try

Amazing food at an even better price! The cart owner/server is very friendly and quick. I ordered the chicken on pita, bought two but could only finish one in one sitting! Large portions and they also have vegetarian options and doesn’t have to be spicy if you want something mild. A hidden gem in Arlington.

If you're looking for a fair priced lox bagel with a very nice amount of salmon, this is the place to try. It's very tasty and the salmon tastes very fresh.

One thing I'm on the fence about is the ordering and pick up processes. Some things, like coffee drinks, are ordered where you pay rather than the main Order Here line. New customers seem to get tripped up a lot and since the place is pretty packed when I visit, you get the small sense of chaos. Notwithstanding, they give you order numbers for some menu items while others are simply called out out when ready, leaving a debate as to whether the meal is yours or the patron you didn't see waiting somewhere else that says they ordered the same thing. Can be sometimes maddening.

Have been ordering/eating at this savory establishment for 10 years now (working at the same building). Convenient of course, but they have awesome food from breakfast to lunch at a pretty reasonable price...and they cater as well!

Inexpensive and delicious bagels - only $2.19 for a bagel and cream cheese!
Other breakfast items are a great deal too - $5 for two eggs, choice of meat, hash browns, and toast!
Lunch options are solid with lots of deli meats and sandwiches
Quick service in the morning and afternoon
Excellent grilled vegetarian sandwich.  Perfect for lunch.

This place is awesome for breakfast and lunch sandwiches!

Their iced coffee has iced as coffee which equates to no dilution. So simple but no other places like Starbucks and three other coffee shop around Rosslyn does it. The sandwiches are hearty and comes freshed card me everyday.

Why this place only has 16 reviews when I see tons of traffic for the last 5 Years puzzles me?!?!

Great customer service, horrible food.  Worst sandwich I've ever had.  Bread was dry and crumbly, turkey was mediocre and way too much mayo.  The reason potbelly toasts their sandwiches is too his the poor quality bread.  Two stars only because the employees were all friendly.
Decided to have an early lunch at Potbelly today, and got their veggie sandwich with mushrooms with avocado and a dash Italian seasoning. Delicious!

We went in and ordered 2 sandwiches: Turkey Avocado and BLTA. After placing our order with one person, the sandwiches moved on to the next station where they ask you for any extra toppings. We noted what else we wanted, paid, and left. Seemed easy enough, however we got back to our hotel and realized they had ONLY put our toppings on the sandwich and NONE of what we ordered. No avocado, no tomato, no lettuce, etc. They did add the meats but the bacon was completely black. And the cherry on top? A $17 charge for 2 subs.

Try Potbelly’s breakfast, the toasted sandwiches are awesome. The experience could have been better, it was 8:30AM when we arrived and they were out of eggs. After about a 5 minute wait we ordered. We received our food and Coffee cups, there was enough for one cup in the decanter, so after another five minutes we had coffee to go with our breakfast

Potbelly is close to work,so it is a convenient place to get lunch. I try to beat the lunch crowd by getting there before 11:45. Usually, service is good and fairly quick. This is one of the more affordable places to eat in Rosslyn.

The food was good and price was crazy high. We ordered for our daughters and my wife. I got a coffee and had a couple of bits from their orders. We enjoyed the place. It was nice and clean with good music playing. I went to wash my hands after, but there as no soap in the bathroom, and I let the staff know, and washed my hands in another restroom.
Excellent burrito bowl.   Actively cleaned during my visit.   Older decor.  Very quick service.   Quite tasty, and seemingly very healthy - no grease/fat.   Moderate price.  Would certainly return.

Nice tacos. They have self-serve order screens with help if needed. Prices are pretty accessible and the food is good. One or two tacos should be enough for most people. They also have Jarritos for a complete Mexican experience 😃

I was staying in the Residence Inn across the street and decided to give District Taco a try.   I ordered 3 fish tacos and nachos. Everything tasted great and the temperature was perfect.  The price was a bit more than I would have liked but it is understandable for the location. I requested extra queso on the nachos for about $3 additional I don't think that was added to my order.  If it was added it was definitely not worth the $3 additional charge.  Overall if you are looking for good fish tacos and are close by I recommend

Stopped by District Taco for lunch today, placed my order at one of their self-serve screens: ordered 2 tacos (one corn, and other flour tortilla) both with chicken with a variety of sides, each decorado a little different from their choice of fresh toppings. Delicious and reasonably priced!

My wife and I love this place. They have don’t have a lot indoor seating, but they have some outdoor seating.  I love their buffalo pizza, and garlic knots.They only have street parking, or garage parking near by. Best pizza in the DMV.
Tiny place - big flavor! They have the best NY style pizza around. Today, I got a couple of slices of my favorite pie Supreme. Yes, they're that good!

The place itself is very small and crowded so I would not recommend eating in but their delivery pizza is the best in the area. I am rather picky when it comes to NY style pizza but they do not disappoint!  The only area competition is Bronx Pizza in Clarendon which is a better sit and eat choice but their pizza has gone downhill since they stopped offering draft beer.
Delicious pizza served fresh, sold by slice and whole, one slice is 5$ regardless of the type of pizza slice 🍕 you order

This place is as good as a NY pizza place. I was pleasantly surprised at how tasty this pizza was. I got a few different styles and they all tasted great. I strongly recommend "the grandmother" if you like a heavy tomato base. The only nitpicky thing that I have to mention is the cheese falling off quite easily but that didn't ruin the taste at all.

For the salad restaurants this is one of the best ones. This location is great, Lauren was really nice with suggestions on what to add to have a salad that was a little spicy. The greens are fresh and they have a lot of options and combinations. One of the best things is right around the corner is a out door seating area that is wonderful in the evenings.

Their salads made me Sick! I don’t know what their hygienic standards are in that restaurant. Based on the way these salads were prepared (ex: Touching a dirty surface before grabbing greens with spiked gloves), I’m not feeling well right now & will never order from them again!
Huge salad and delicious too. Awesome vibe too. Not busy on Sunday.

I've been here at this location several times in the months of june, july, august, september and this month.
I like the salads that i had, they were fresh but portions were on the small side.
Service was cold even when business was slow, paper napkins accessible but needs to be guided ko and tap water dispenser inoperable until this month. One time this month, the complimentary slice of bread that comes with the salad was not available, no alternative offered so i have to buy the focaccia bread.
Hopefully, change can happen and business at this location continue to thrive.

I visited this location on a casual Sunday afternoon, hoping for a break from the usual Chop't experience. There was no line and the restaurant was empty, perfect for getting in and out on a working weekend. I ordered the Fish Taco warm bowl as my first experience with SweetGreen.   The prep was quick and the server was pleasant enough. Unfortunately that is all of the positives I can really say about the experience. The greens and cabbage were unremarkable and with no real distinction from similar salad places. The hot sauce and cilantro jalapeno vinaigrette added a much needed kick of flavor to the bowl.  The most disappointing aspect of the meal however was the paltry amount of roasted Steelhead (salmon's sustainable cousin) provided; roughly one to two ounces at best. As a whole the serving size of the salad in general was quite small compared to other eateries, if not for the quinoa I would venture to say that the salad would have been unsatisfying. With the whole meal clocking in at a whopping $13.48, I have to say that the whole meal was not worth the price tag. Long story short: Not worth the cost, if you want similar flavor with a more reasonable price tag look into another establishment. If you want to Insta your lunch and tell your followers about your responsibly raised and sourced meal; this is your place.

Overall: 4 on the salad/ 2 on the price tag; solid 3.

Mannnn! So I always get a steak egg and cheese bagel from McDonald’s so I KNOW what they should look and taste like. Now if you have every eaten one you know how greasy and drippy it can be. Which I love! I took a pic of the paper just to show how dehydrated my sandwich was. The only thing that saved it was the egg. The bagel was hard, the steak was like jerky and this was at 9AM so why is NOTHING FRESH?! This probably was made for someone else because the entire sandwich just looked like it had been sitting. The cheese on my bagel will show you that! I had someone else go inside for me so I can’t rate customer service but even the biscuit that my friend ordered was hard as a rock. Enjoy the pics and do better AM SHIFT!

Come on in here!  You don't have to skip breakfast any more!  It only takes a moment to pick up your order.  The staff I dealt with, and every staff person I observed, were kind, gracious and helpful.  They even fulfilled an order without payment when the app went wrong.  This gem is the good McDonalds. Be sure to mark it as a favorite in the app and enjoy breakfast every day.

Night shift ladies were amazing .
I got there with my family group around 9  people and get my food and my drinks ready in less then 10 minutes
They did great and they are also very friendly

Horrible. Managers have attitudes and the cashier was running around confused. Only way you make money at this location is by fault. People should really boycott all you corporate elites for such horrible service. I was patient as it was a little busy. I couldn’t even put in an order on the kiosk. You should rethink your management team. They are horrible. If you don’t like your job then leave. This is the last straw. I’m making this personal and a movement. Time you all start feeling it in your pockets.

One woman who works there during the night shift, she could be a manager or something (she is wearing a different uniform) has the biggest attitude on the world. I was picking up an order and she saw me waiting for it and she put it to the side. When I told her she rolled her eyes and asked for the order number, and instantly looked away, not even waiting, for the answer. I have never seen someone this rude, looking down on people. Every order she puts out, sorry, she throws it in front of you, has to include an eye rolling, and let’s not even talk about if you dare to ask something from her. I wonder what is the attitude for?! Also, be careful if you are picking up from her because she gives you a bad rating on the delivery app… I guess that’s how she makes herself feel better

The garden and the reflection pool are very nice, but the food is average and the service is pretty bad. Be aware that they charge 20% tip automatically (no option to remove it, but an option for additional tip!) despite the fact that it's self service.
Cool art park with lots of open space that has a cafe serving light fare, beer wine and coffee.
This place is the best kept secret in DC. Just don't expect to be able to eat, or if you're lucky, eat without hassles.

We were going to have a snack before the show at the Kennedy Center but it was "closed for a private event". Nothing on the website. Oh well. The Mediterranean place across the street is hopping because everyone had their plans blown up.

Update: I double checked and now there is a tiny banner at the top of the page saying they are closed today. I definitely don't remember it being there yesterday.

This is a nice spot, but the staff was not very friendly to us.I would come again but bring my own water (which they say you can’t do on their website)  I should edit that, one staff member was helpful and one was not. The restaurant also does not have very many options food and drink wise  and does not provide tap water to drink (which is against the law). We tried to get water and were told to get it out of the bathroom tap??? Very odd, not to mention gross. Prices were usual for DC. It is a nice spot but needs to execute better to live up to the Kennedy Center standard.

I first tried Sfoglina when a friend got me a birthday cake from them! :') As a self-proclaimed cake connoisseur, their chocolate hazelnut is one of the absolute best! I l-o-v-e Sfoglina! I finally was able to dine-in a few months back on Christmas Eve and we tasted many different pastas - one of my favs was the squid ink! Absolutely delicious desserts- try the hazelnut chocolate cake!  The restaurant is beautiful and at the top of my list! It's a permanent dinner location every time I'm in DC!

We found out about Sfoglina from searching Michelin Bib Gourmand awardees online. Bib Gourmand is the Michelin award that emphasizes “value-for-money” award and that great food doesn’t have to come with a hefty price tag! We were in.

We started off with a glass of wine each, Build Your Own Mozarella bar: burrata and artichokes. For entree I ordered the Braised Beef Agnolotti del Plin; it was perfect. Melt-in-your mouth delicious!

My husband ordered the Papardelle - he loved it as well and halfway through we switched plates.

Picture not included - Rosemary Bread; really good.

Finished off with the  Piemontese Chocolate Gianduja Cake; chocolate ganache and hazelnuts = A MUST.

The experience may have dampened because on my reservation I had indicated outdoor dining and came with that expectation. Upon arrival the patio wasn’t set up for outdoor dining, our server brought a lamp which went out within 10 min and no music outdoors. This could’ve really elevated the dining experience but the food is good worth it although depending on what subjectively is considered value-for-money our bill was close to $200 after tip for the items pictured below + rosemary bread and 2 glasses of wine which was more than I expected considering the Bib Gourmand badge.

Either way - if you enjoy pasta and good wine then I would recommend this place!

Simply wonderful. Me and a buddy did the pasta experience and while very intimate for two friends in can hold up to six and the experience made it all worth while. We had a great conversation over wonderful food. This is a new concept they are trying and the Rosslyn team is nailing it. Go today and try their pasta experience.

Maddie was our waiter and she was very nice and knowledgable about the food. She helped my friend replace her salad's dressing. The salad originally had too much blue cheese. The chery dressing was awesome and fresh. It got a little cold inside at dinner.

We were in the area and someone suggested the Rosslyn location. From the service I received from Jose @ the bar to the AMAZING food that came after. I ordered 1/2 Potato Gnocchi and 1/2 of the Rigatoni (small portions) but worth the experience.

P.S.-Try their lemonchello.
Good price and good service. I go often for lunch and the staff is always friendly. The restaurant is clean and comfy. Highly recommended.

I’m a local so I’ve been here several times over the years and it’s usually always a good experience. Fast, healthy, reasonably priced and near my home. Service- tonight it was okay, but not great. I got the vibe from the associate like I’m tired and hurry up. Overall, despite a hit or miss with the customer service, it’s a decent spot to get a fast casual meal.

I literally eat here EVERY day! why ? aside from the fact that this is the most healthy food in the area (salad, Dah!) the food is always fresh, the team here is very welcoming and always nice and smiling. plus, they also have an app that allows you to get points, pretty cool!
I loved the food, Fresh and high quality ingredients,  The customer service is very pleasant  I really recommend it
It became my favorite salad place, a great variety and above all excellent attention from the partners, they are very friendly despite how busy they are.

Visited on a recent trip to DC. This is one of the coolest restaurant/food court concepts we’ve ever seen. Food was fantastic, menu options were exquisite and quite varied, and the service was amazing - right up there with the best service we’ve ever had. Our server Roland was phenomenal. Attentive, friendly and accommodating. Absolute five star experience. We will be back next time we’re in town. Highly recommend the fish tacos.

Beautiful space. Food are not that exciting. Food can be order through QR code or through bartenders if you seating at the bar. There's a woman standing behind guest service desk you can order through her as well. Pick a table and don't move because the food runner wont be able to find you or someone will take your seat. Big space but only two unisex bathroom.

Assembly has great potential. The Interior is beautiful and cozy and i love ordering from the phone. Service was quick and we had a kind waiter who checked on us periodically. We ordered steak and cheese with tater tots , soup dumplings and a hamburger with fries . Let’s start with the soup dumplings, they were good. I’ve never had soup dumplings so not sure what they’re suppose to taste like but those were good.  My bacon burger tasted like nothing honestly. All I tasted was cheese and there was no seasoning , and the bacon didn’t have a nice flavor even though it looked delicious. The fries were extremely over cooked and tasted like they have been sitting for awhile . My bf got the steak and cheese and that was okay. It honestly didn’t taste like anything. All we tasted was cheese and a hint of red and green pepper . I wanted to taste some of the sweets and menu items but a lot of them were out of stock even though we came early . I had high expectations since the reviews looked promising but probably won’t be coming back.

Cute place with a wide range of options for food and drinks. They have happy hour deals. Doesn’t get too crowded so it’s easy to get a table. And the online ordering process is very convenient. My disappointment was mainly with the food. Ordered the crab Mac and cheese and it was very bland. Good sized portion but lacked flavor. And the shrimp burrito was also pretty tasteless. I’d go back for drinks but would be hesitant to order food again. Other things to note is limited parking availability. And finally, was disappointed when a server asked us to move from one of the “rooms/sections” to accommodate a group. As far as I could tell, there was no reservation for that space (I didn’t see any signs that the space/tables were reserved) and it seemed this was a last minute request from the group. I get trying to be accommodating but it seemed to inconvenience some and defeat the purpose of an “open concept” location.

Truly a great space. It's huge and varied with its types of good stations and sitting areas. They leverage tech in such a fashion that where you sit out where you order over your phone, good is bright to you.

The food is hit or miss. The hamburger was amazing! The mussels were a little odd - broth on the traditional model, the pizza solid. The drinks have been a bit inconsistent in the few times I've been there.  Both great, and than not great.

I think long term they'll work out the kinks, and this place has a load of potential.

Delicious Korean food! Absolutely loved our quick dinner here. I had the purple rice burrito 🌯 with spicy pork and creamy sriracha. It was great - I loved that the restaurant was 100% gluten free! The only drawback is it's takeout only, but we were able to eat next door. Will definitely visit again!
Kraving for Korean food today. Got their purple rice bowl with both chicken (dak) and beef (bulgogi), with corn, kimchi, cilantro, topped with creamy sriracha. Absolutely delicious 냠 !

This place has amazing value for the price and I always get two super filling meals out of one bowl. The chicken is so delicious and all the ingredients mix super well together. I don’t usually love bowl places but SeoulSpice is a weekly choice for me.
The food and service are great. I had the rice and noodle bowls with vegetables as part of my Meatless Monday meal plan. I highly recommend coming here for your grab and go food for lunch or dinner.

Where’s the Beef!?  Cmon Seoulspice…. Got your Bulgogi bowl with rice and only get one little scoop of Beef!?  80% of the bowl was toppings mixed in with rice with small chunks of beef.  Beef is kinda tough and not really seasoned.

For $15 for a bowl you all need to do 2 scoops of protein in the bowls.  Not worth the price for what you get.

If not we can go next door and get double the meat for half the price.  Same thing with Cava across the street.

Up your game Seoulspice!

We came here for date night/early dinner after the movies. We order mainly the small plates/appetizers to share and drinks. Will definitely be back to try the main dishes. It’s a little hard to find, no outside sign. It feel like you’re walking into an office building with the revolving door. Street parking along the block available. Good food, good drinks, service was good. Very intimate atmosphere. Make sure you make a reservation, we booked for 5:00pm and by the time we left there was maybe 1-2 tables available.

What a gem! Upscale speakeasy (the entrance is on the street level, not up the stairs that lewd to another restaurant, the Salt name is on the rug under the door, but not on the door itself, which can be a bit confusing) with dim lighting and quiet enough for an easy conversation. We only tried cocktails, and all of them were fantastic! Incredible presentation and great service, too - can’t wait to try their happy hour!

Wow, I love the ambiance of this casual establishment. Located underground, dim lights, speakeasy vibes. Music, food and drinks are AMAZING! Great menu, fast services, small plates, a little overprice but very filling. Staff is very welcoming attentive and friendly, ask for Jamie, she’s the best! We did have difficulties finding the restaurant but it was well worth it! Definitely will return and highly recommend.

Food and drinks are AMAZING!
It’s like a speakeasy. The music, vibe, and atmosphere of SALT was welcoming and fun!
Finding the restaurant was a little difficult, but look for the big brown door inside of the rotating doors and you’ll be set!

Sitting at the bar is the best way to enjoy this adventurous speakeasy bar. What a great atmosphere with super friendly staff. The bartenders put all of their skills on display and add entertainment and flair to the drinks. If you order the right drinks you won’t be disappointed!

Pictured is Jennasen making the Toki’n on the Bayou. A smoked cocktail served over an ice globe stamped with the “salt” logo. Oscar was terrific and funny with his many ad lib comments. And don’t forget Ben, busily collecting and cleaning the glasses!

We stopped in after a brisk walk from the Clarendon neighborhood where we had had some dinner. Previous reviews led us to the big wooden door and the short flight of stairs down to the dimly lit bar. (there is an elevator too). We didn’t try any food, but it looked amazing. Prices were appropriate for the area and the quality was high and we were pleased. We were there on a Saturday night and it was not too crowded, the vibe was chill, and they do close a little early, but they didn’t rush us out. What a great place to have a drink!
